page.title: 19A STOTTESDON FARMER'S DAY
page.content: {My name is Robin.}I am 44. I farm a tenanted farm of 315 acres, mixing dairy, sheep and arable enterprises. My day starts at 7.00am with the {milking}routine.After cleaning up & sterilising the equipment, I have breakfast at 9.30-10.00,while opening the post. After the milk has been collected, the bulk tank has to be cleaned & the cows put out to grass. Meanwhile my farmworker has walked the fields to check on the{sheep.}The rest of the morning is spent on{field or {stock work}in season, which continues until the evening milking with a break for lunch(1.30-2.00pm).My evening meal can be any time between 7.00 & 9.00pm. After that I might have some more outside work to do, or{administrative {work.}I read the farming press,or doze in front of the TV, and go to bed at about 11.30 pm. Except when lambing!
